intro: Hondbesseion olens var. normale, commonly known as the common hondbesseion, is a perennial herb native to the temperate regions of Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pale blue or purple in color, blooming from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and aromatic, with a slightly rough texture. It prefers well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
